requirements:
Create a simple web-based Tic-Tac-Toe game.
    
    Requirements:
    1. Single HTML file with embedded CSS and JavaScript
    2. 3x3 grid for the game board
    3. Two players (X and O) taking turns
    4. Check for win conditions (rows, columns, diagonals)
    5. Display winner or draw
    6. Reset button to start new game
    
    Keep it simple and clean.

functional_requirements.description: Display a 3x3 grid that serves as the game board.
acceptance_criteria: The game board is rendered as a 3x3 grid on page load.
Each cell in the grid is clickable.

functional_requirements.description: Allow two players, 'X' and 'O', to take turns placing their marks on the grid.
acceptance_criteria: The game alternates between Player 'X' and Player 'O' after each valid move.
A player can only place their mark in an empty cell.
The current player's turn is clearly indicated.

functional_requirements.description: Check for a winning condition after each move.
acceptance_criteria: The game correctly identifies a win when a player has three of their marks in a horizontal row.
The game correctly identifies a win when a player has three of their marks in a vertical column.
The game correctly identifies a win when a player has three of their marks along a diagonal.
Once a win is detected, no more moves can be made.

functional_requirements.description: Check for a draw condition when the board is full with no winner.
acceptance_criteria: The game correctly identifies a draw when all cells are filled and no winning condition is met.
Once a draw is detected, no more moves can be made.

functional_requirements.description: Display the game's outcome to the players.
acceptance_criteria: A message is displayed announcing the winning player (e.g., 'Player X Wins!').
A message is displayed announcing a draw (e.g., 'The game is a draw!').

functional_requirements.description: Provide a 'Reset' button to clear the board and start a new game.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking the 'Reset' button clears all marks from the board.
Clicking the 'Reset' button resets the game state to the beginning (Player 'X's turn).
The game is ready for a new round after the reset button is clicked.

non_functional_requirements.description: The game interface should be intuitive and easy to understand for new players.
metrics: A new user can start and complete a game without instructions.
Game controls (clicking cells, reset button) are self-explanatory.

non_functional_requirements.description: Player moves should be reflected on the board instantly.
metrics: Visual feedback for a move appears in under 100ms.
The UI remains responsive at all times.

blueprint.explanation: This architecture outlines a simple web-based game using a modern, decoupled technology stack. The frontend is a single-page application built with React (using Vite for tooling), providing a dynamic and responsive user interface. The backend is a high-performance REST API built with Python and FastAPI, which handles all game logic, user authentication, and data persistence. Communication between the client and server is done via JSON over HTTP. Authentication is managed using JWT (JSON Web Tokens). A SQLite database is used for simplicity and ease of setup, with SQLAlchemy as the ORM for data modeling and interaction. The entire system is designed to be containerized with Docker for consistent development and deployment.

Core game logic. Manages creating, updating, and retrieving game states for a given user.
